alert.note: Alert for Susitna Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 20 at 4:22AM AKST until February 22 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MONDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 16 inches possible. * WHERE...Susitna Valley. * WHEN...From Monday afternoon through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Monday evening and Tuesday morning commutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow begins to overspread the Susitna Valley late Monday morning. Snowfall rates will increase Monday afternoon and continue through Tuesday morning before tapering off and ending around midday Tuesday. The heaviest snow accumulations are expected in the foothills of the Alaska Range with 10 to 16 inches possible along the Parks Highway from Talkeetna north.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
